trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> objects that are used by data-bound controls such as <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView"></xref>.

The DataControlFieldCollection class represents a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField> objects used by data-bound controls to specify how their child controls are presented.
The DataControlFieldCollection class derives from <xref:System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection>, an abstract base collection class used specifically to store <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> objects.
A <xref:System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection> object influences the behavior of a DataControlFieldCollection object.
<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField> objects that are dynamically added to the collection will be re-added to the control when state is restored.
This means that a field needs to be added, removed, or changed just once instead of on each postback, as most collection types in ASP.NET require.
(The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField> class implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface, which enables it to store its state in ASP.NET view state.
) Use the DataControlFieldCollection class to programmatically manage a set of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField> objects.
Note that it is more common to define these fields declaratively.
You can add, insert, and remove <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField> objects using the appropriate methods of the DataControlFieldCollection class.

To programmatically retrieve <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField> objects from a collection, use one of following methods: - Use the indexer to get a single <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField> object from the collection using array notation.

- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection.GetEnumerator%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName>-implemented object, which can then be used to get items from the collection.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection.Count%2A> property specifies the total number of items in the collection, and is commonly used to determine the upper bound of the collection.

You can add items to and remove items from the collection using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCollection.Add%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCollection.Insert%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCollection.Remove%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCollection.RemoveAt%2A> methods.

If you are using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField> objects that are automatically created (for example, when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.AutoGenerateColumns%2A> property is `true`) are not stored in the publicly accessible fields collection.
You can only access and manipulate <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField> objects that are not automatically generated.
The following table lists the different data control field classes and how they are used.

|Parameter Class|Description| |---------------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField>|The abstract base class for all fields.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BoundField>|A data-bound control field that is used to bind to text or data retrieved from an ASP.NET data source control.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ButtonFieldBase>|A data-bound control field that encapsulates general button functionality.

<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ButtonField> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxField> are derived from it.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ButtonField>|A data-bound control field that displays at least one button.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxField>|A data-bound control field that displays a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox> control.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandField>|A data-bound control field that displays actions that can be performed on the data displayed by the row (or column), such as edit, update, or delete.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLinkField>|A data-bound control field that displays a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink> control.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageField>|A data-bound control field that displays an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Image> control.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplateField>|A data-bound control field that displays custom content in a data-bound control.|
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCollection"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to create a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCollection> class.
> [!NOTE] > This constructor is used primarily by control developers.
Appends the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> object to the end of the collection.
Use the Add method to append a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField> object to the end of the collection.
This implementation of the method takes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField> object specified by the `field` parameter and appends it to the collection.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> to append to the collection.
Creates a copy of the current collection.
Use the CloneFields method to create a copy of the current collection.
This method is used primarily by design-time dialog boxes to implement rollback behavior when an operation is canceled.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCollection"></xref> that contains a copy of each data control field in the current collection.
Determines whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCollection"></xref> collection contains a specific <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> object.
This method performs a linear search.
It determines equality by calling <xref:System.Object.Equals%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> to locate in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCollection"></xref>.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCollection"></xref> contains the specified field; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Copies the entire <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCollection"></xref> collection to a compatible one-dimensional <xref:System.Array>, starting at the specified index of the target array.
The one-dimensional <xref:System.Array> that is the destination of the elements copied from <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCollection"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Array> must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in `array` at which copying begins.
array is .
index is less than zero.
array is multidimensional.
-or- The number of fields in the source collection is greater than the available space from index to the end of the destination array.
To be added.
To be added.

Occurs when the fields in the collection change, usually as the result of a <xref:System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection.Clear*>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCollection.Insert*>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCollection.Remove*> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCollection.Add*> method call.

This event is also raised anytime a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> in the collection raises its <xref uid="langword_csharp_FieldChanged" name="FieldChanged" href=""></xref> event.

The FieldsChanged event is raised when the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection.Clear%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCollection.Insert%2A>, or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCollection.Remove%2A> method is called.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
To be added.
To be added.
Determines the index of a specific <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> object in the collection.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> to locate in the collection.
The index of the field parameter, if it is found in the collection; otherwise, -1.

Inserts the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> object into the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCollection"></xref> collection at the specified index.
The zero-based index at which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> is inserted.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> to insert.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> object at the specified index in the collection.

Use this indexer to get a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField> object from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCollection> collection at the specified index, using array notation.
The zero-based index of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> to retrieve from the collection.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> at the specified index in the collection.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
Removes the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> object from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCollection"></xref> collection.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> to remove from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCollection"></xref>.

Removes the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> object at the specified index from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCollection"></xref> collection.
The index of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> to remove.
To be added.
